Length.name: Meter
Length.description: The length of the path traveled by the light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299,792,458 of a second.

Length.name: Mile (disguised as an Inch)
Length.description: Give me an Inch and I will take it a Mile!

Length.name: Hand
Length.description: Used to measure the height of horses. Equal to third of a foot

Length.name: Manhattan Block
Length.description: The length of a north-south block in downtown Manhattan.

Length.name: Smoot
Length.description: This is the height of Oliver Smoot

Length.name: Sheppy
Length.description: The closest distance at which sheep remain picturesque

Length.name: Potrzebie
Length.description: The thickness of isse 26 of Mad Magazine. This unit was created by Donald Knuth.

Area.name: Bourbon Biscuit
Area.description: A British biscuit where all brands are apparently 61x30mm in size. Once suggested worthy to be an SI Unit of measurement.

Area.name: American Football Field
Area.description: The Area of an American Football Field, including the endzones.

Area.name: Canadian Football Field
Area.description: The Area of a Canadian Football Field, including the endzones.

Area.name: Morgen
Area.description: The amount of land that can be tilled by one person behind an ox in the morning hours of the day. This is quite vague, especially if you are chatting with the ox instead of working.

Volume.name: Cubic Meter
Volume.description: A cube with each edge being one meter in length.

Volume.name: Super Foot
Volume.description: 1 inch x 1 foot x 1 foot. Used to measure lumber, but you can use it to measure whatever you like - it's super!

Volume.name: Cord
Volume.description: A nicely cut and neatly-arranged amount of firewood

Volume.name: Avocado
Volume.description: The volume of an average Avocado, cursed seed included.

Mass.name: Smaller Mission Burrito
Mass.description: The mass of a smaller super burrito from Mission District in San Francisco, CA.

Mass.name: Larger Mission Burrito
Mass.description: The mass of a larger burrito from Mission District in San Francisco, CA.

Mass.name: Bag of Cement
Mass.description: The mass of a bag of cement on the concrete and petroleum industry. Not to be confused with a bag of cement from the olden days.

Mass.name: Short Hundredweight
Mass.description: Also known as the central, thisis equivalent to 100 pounds.

Mass.name: Long hundredweight
Mass.description: This unit is deprecated as of 1985 but we include it to be backward compatible.

Time.name: Second
Time.description: Give me a second while I look this up...

Time.name: Microcentury
Time.description: The length of a lecture. Feel free to walk out if it goes over.

Time.name: Nanocentury
Time.description: Close enough to pi seconds, this aws considered a good response time for user products back in the 60s.

Time.name: Microforthnight
Time.description: This is supposed to be an amusing unit of measurement.

Time.name: Dirty Toasts
Time.description: The number of toasts that would be contaminated assuming that a new piece of toast is consecutively dropped and not picked up within five seconds, thus violating the five-second rule.

Time.name: Fortnight
Time.description: The unambigous way to denote 2 weeks of time. No more 'bi-weekly' nonsense.

Time.name: New York Minute
Time.description: The amount of time between the traffic light turning green and the car behind you honking.

Digital Storage.name: Megabyte
Digital Storage.description: This was considered a lot of spcae back in the day.

Digital Storage.name: CD-ROM
Digital Storage.description: Wow, two copies of Encyclopedia Britannica can fit in this much space! Why would you want two copies remains to be ascertained.

Digital Storage.name: Library of Congress
Digital Storage.description: All the text from the Library of Congress takes up ten terabytes. You could carry it in you pockets!

Digital Storage.name: Byte
Digital Storage.description: A byte consists of eight bits.

Digital Storage.name: Bentobox
Digital Storage.description: A bentobox is worth 96 bits. In other contexts, it is worth one lunch, but we are talking data storage, not stomach storage.

Energy.name: Joule
Energy.description: This is the SI Unit of measureent for energy.

Energy.name: Gram Calorie
Energy.description: The amount of energy needed to raise a gram of water by 1 degree Celcius.

Energy.name: Kilocalorie
Energy.description: Also known as Calorie with a capital C, this is what appears on many nutrition labels. Yep you are eating kilocalories, not little calories.

Energy.name: Foot-pound
Energy.description: The energy needed to raise one pound distance of one foot. Useful to know when fishing up freshly-baked pound cakes from the windowsill below yours.

Energy.name: WHAT hours?!
Energy.description: When you are late and every cell in your body expends as much energy possible to get to your destination.
